page.title: 03Fernhurst Church.
page.content: Fernhurst Church. The village church is mainly a nineteenth century building,having been damaged by fire which necessitated new building at that time.It is not of great architectural interest though small parts of the building date from earlier times.For example,the font is of Norman origin and part of the north wall is of historical interest. The church has a spire and the nave has a main aisle with a side aisle to the south so that there is an unbalanced appearance to the nave.The chancel is situated at the east end of the main aisle where the altar is located but no choir stalls.The organ is a modern instrument located alongside the main aisle at the western end where the choir stalls are.A new vicar was appointed in October,1985..
